title: My emails
content: My emails are no longer coming to me via Type App on Thunderbird/Mozilla. My email provider says it's not their problem, the problem is with your end. Can you help? Thanks David
creator: davidashton641

title: Thunderbird not saving open windows in session.json
content: If I have a number of tabs open in my main Thunderbird window and also a few messages open in their own windows, I just down Thunderbird cleanly, and then I restart, I get the main window with all of the tabs, but I do not get any of the open windows to reopen. I deleted my session.json in case it was corrupt. But I verified that, when I close Thunderbird, it creates a new session.json that only contains information for the main window, and not the additional windows. How do I get Thunderbird to store my ENTIRE session, including all the open windows, in session.json?
creator: rmqjones

title: Drag & Drop not working in Ver. 145 Address Book
content: The new Address Book version 145 has All Address Books, Address Book, Personal Address Book, and Collected Addresses. I created several mailing list in the Personal Address Book but I can no longer drag and drop from that book to the mailing lists. Suggestions?

title: Registration failed
content:
Seid einer Woche habe ich keinen Zugang mehr zu meinen E-Mails. Es sagt mir jedes mal "Anmeldung auf dem Server imap.gmx.net mit Benutzernamen "thias.weber@gmx.de" fehlgeschlagen" Ich hatte zuvor nichts verändert und alle eingegebenen Daten sind korrekt. Auch eine Anmeldung auf einem anderen Gerät oder bei einem Freund (bei dem alles Funktioniert) führte zu keinem Ergebnis. Neuinstallation auch nicht!

For a week, I haven't been able to access my emails. It tells me every time "Login to the server imap.gmx.net with username 'thias.weber@gmx.de' failed" I hadn't changed anything beforehand and all the entered data is correct. Even logging in on another device or at a friend's place (where everything works) did not lead to any result. Reinstallation doesn't help either!

pleace help!
creator: m.weber-mo

title: Hovering over a link doesn't seem to work any more
content:
I used to be able to hover over (or right-click, I think) on a link and have the underlying URL display at the bottom of the page, which was quite useful for sorting out bogus emails and destinations.

I can't say when, but lately this behaviour doesn't seem to work any more. I've been through as many Thunderbird settings as I can find, hoping to learn that I've inadvertently turned this off and all I need to do is turn it back on again but so far have not come across anything that seems to address this.

Can anyone help? Any advice or suggestions most gratefully received.

Thanks in advance, Alun Bell
creator: alunbell

title: cannot send email on my AOL/compuserve account, new problem today
content:
Suddenly I can not longer send emails with Tbird in my AOL/Compuserve account. I can receive emails and save to drafts folder and read emails, but cannot send. I get this error: Login to server smtp.compuserve.com with username eber***@compuserve.com failed. Here is what I have done.

1. This happened on my main laptop and on my MS SurfaceGo2. Both have been working fine as of last night and have been for months. Both are win11 machines. 2. I generated a new app specific PW and still fails. 3. I went to my old win10 machine and same problem. 4. I am running TBird 128.14.0 5. On my iphone I can still send email via compuserve just fine.

Suggestions?
creator: eberger5

title: Login to account "my name" failed
content:
This error message keeps popping up many times a day and is very annoying. I notice that others are getting the same error message but haven't found a fix for it. See image of the whole error message attached.

The weird thing is no matter which of the 3 options I choose it keeps coming back... sometimes within a few second. Also it doesn't prevent me from getting my email. Really odd.  ???

Anyone find a fix yet? Thanks.
creator: bintyre

title: Second email not being authenticated - weeks of conversations with Comcast
content:
I got a new computer six weeks ago. A large portion of that I have been trying to get Thunderbird to work. I have been on the phone for hours and hours with comcast, going over settings to no avail. I have deleted and reinstalled Thunderbird over and over.

This time a screen wants to connect to Xfinity and then says the connection was refused. Interestingly I have conneted in the past and can get the history of emails to download, but not able to send emails. I have messed with the outgoing port, and various combinations. Usually the "Continue" key gets grayed out. And I can't do anything.

I have used Thunderbird for twenty years I'm certain. I'm about to give up and switch. I don't know what else to do.
creator: mrwayyne
